intro: Geranium stepporum, commonly known as the steppe geranium, is a perennial herb native to the steppes of Eurasia. It typically grows to a height of about 20–50 centimeters and has a basal rosette of leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, pink to purple flowers during the summer months. Its leaves are usually oval to lance-shaped with serrated edges. Geranium stepporum is well adapted to dry, open habitats and is often found in meadows and grasslands.
